metadata.title: CVE-2016-2853 on Ubuntu 22.04 LTS (jammy) - low
metadata.description: The aufs module for the Linux kernel 3.x and 4.x does not properly restrictthe mount namespace, which allows local users to gain privileges bymounting an aufs filesystem on top of a FUSE filesystem, and then executinga crafted setuid program.

criterions.comment: linux-gke package in jammy is affected and may need fixing.
linux-gkeop package in jammy is affected and may need fixing.
linux-ibm package in jammy is affected and may need fixing.
linux-azure-fde package in jammy is affected and may need fixing.
linux-oem-6.0: while related to the CVE in some way, a decision has been made to ignore this issue (note: 'superseded by linux-oem-6.1, was needs-triage').
linux-realtime: while related to the CVE in some way, a decision has been made to ignore this issue (note: 'superseded by Ubuntu Pro ppa version').
